title.rendered: “Chameleon: Wild Boys,” Season 3 of Hit Con-Themed Podcast Series From Campside Media, Premieres Today

content.rendered:
New Season Follows the Shocking True Story of the “Bush Boys,” Two Teens Who Claimed They Were Raised in the British Columbia Wilderness

First Two Episodes Are Available Now

Subscribe on Apple Podcasts for Special Access to Bonus Series ‘Art of the Con’

New York, NY – January 25, 2022 – Campside Media, in partnership with Sony Music Entertainment, today debuted the new season of hit investigative podcast series “Chameleon” with the premiere of “Chameleon: Wild Boys.” This season of the true crime series follows the shocking true story of two young men who emerged from the woods in a small Canadian town telling an incredible story: they’d been raised in an extremely remote cabin in the wilderness, and this was their first-ever contact with society – except nothing they said was true. The first two episodes are available now. 

As the “Chameleon” franchise continues to explore the art of scam artists, “Chameleon: Wild Boys” tells the story of a generous community who welcomed the ‘Bush Boys’ with open arms, only to find out the boys were not who they said they were. This season’s host, award-winning comedian and journalist Sam Mullins, gives a first-hand account of life in Vernon BC at the time that Kyle and Roen Horn claimed to be entering the modern world for the first time. “Wild Boys” will feature exclusive conversations with ‘Bush Boys’ themselves, their family, and members of the Vernon community.

“As someone who grew up in Vernon and experienced first-hand the outrageous ‘Bush Boys’ story, I’m looking forward to uncovering the bizarre true story of these two strangers who turned my hometown upside down,” said Sam Mullins. “This season of Chameleon will challenge the idea of what a con man is. Every time you think you have these boys figured out, they prove you wrong.”

Subscribe on Apple Podcasts for access to “Art of the Con,” a new exclusive talk show created by Campside co-founder and “Chameleon: Hollywood Con Queen” co-host Josh Dean and journalist Rajiv Golla, which dives into scams and cons ripped from the news – an idea that stemmed from the deluge of listener mail Dean received after “Hollywood Con Queen.” Subscribers can also listen to episodes of “Chameleon: Wild Boys” one week early and ad-free.  

“Chameleon: Wild Boys” is executive produced by Adam Hoff, Josh Dean, Matt Shaer, and Vanessa Grigoriadis at Campside Media. 

Listeners can subscribe to “Chameleon: Wild Boys” on all major podcast platforms, including Apple Podcasts, Spotify, Stitcher, and all major podcast platforms. For more information on “Chameleon: Wild Boys” and all other Sony Podcast shows, follow @SonyPodcasts on Twitter and Instagram.
